results.title: To Chapultepec = A Chapultepec
results.brief_description: This film provides some cultural background to Mexico, especially Chapultepec to students learning elementary Spanish with the text “Entender Y Hablar”. This is a spanish language film that includes new words which describe what four young people do in the city for fun. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: To catch a trout
results.creator_credit: Wilf Gray and Wilf Gray Film Productions
results.brief_description: Lakes in British Columbia are scientifically stocked and trout population controlled by the Fisheries Authority. Surveys are carried out to monitor the ecological balance of the lakes.

results.title: To be or not to be (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mel Brooks, Brooksfilms, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Alan Johnson
results.brief_description: Mel Brooks’ hilarious remake of the Lubitsch comedy classic about a Polish theatre troupe which gets caught up in Hitler’s invasion of Poland. Brooks and Anne Bancroft play the lead actors in the troupe who are forever trying to gain the limelight from each other. When they become involved in a wild plot to threaten the Nazis, their battles become even more comic. The great cast includes Tim Matheson, Jose Ferrer and Charles Durning.

results.title: To be a toolmaker
results.brief_description: The term “toolmaker” in enginerring does not mean the maker of ordinary hand tools such as hammers and screwdrivers. The film illustrates this fact by showing the operation of the special tools that make coins. It shows the production of other special tools, drill jigs, press tools, multi-progression tools and gauges. The film shows the progress of a would-be toolmaker and describes the type of work and training that an apprentice does in an engineering works and also at apprentice classes in a technical college.

results.title: To be a scout
results.brief_description: On his 11th birthday a boy graduates from being a cub to being a boy scout. The various activities of his first year of scouting are shown. These include his first camp, a trip to the Grampians and finally a bicycling camp in Tasmania. The training that scouts receive in disclipine, handicraft and nature study is brought out in the film.

results.title: To be a performer
results.brief_description: This skilful documentary follows Jeff Solow, a young celloist of great promise. The film focuses on his drive to become an accomplished musician. We see him playing professionally although still in college, composing and practising a cadenza, in rehearsal with an orchestra, and on the night of the performance at which he is soloist. His thoughts and observations about music form the commentary.

results.title: To be a conductor
results.brief_description: An absorbing documentary following the activities of the young conductor Michael Tilson Thomas. He studies the score of Brahms’ “Serenade No. 1 for Orchestra”, and finally conducts it at a music festival. The film is enriched by his comments on conducting and the role of music in his life.
